Detailed Description

Functions and structures usefull for common usermode programs to access the VFS and get information

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum VFS_ACCESS

Access methods for files

Enumerator:
VFS_ACC_READ  Used to open a stream that can be read from
VFS_ACC_WRITE  Used to open a stream that can be written to
VFS_ACC_CREATE  Used to create a stream and read from
VFS_ACC_RAS  Used for (R)andom (A)ccess (S)streams - Reading and writing is valid
VFS_ACC_CLOSE  Stream is no longer valid
VFS_ACC_DEL  Delete a file

enum VFS_PAIRACCESS

Access methods for two files

Enumerator:
VFS_PACC_MOVE  Move file1 to file2 (normally not the same as copy and delete!)
VFS_PACC_COPY  Copy file1 to file2
VFS_PACC_HLINK  Link file2 to file1 on the same partition - Link will also work of fs is mounted on a different path - filesystem must support linking
VFS_PACC_SLINK  Link file2 statically to string 'file1' whatever might or might not be mounted as file1

Function Documentation

VFS_TICKET CreateExceptionAccessTicket ( LUString  path  ) 

If the creating process has enough rights to access a file, a ticket will be returned, wich can be sent to other processes allowing them (even if they don't have sufficient rights) to access the file.

Parameters:
path To create ticket for
Returns:
A ticket or an error if not enough rights

VFS_STATUS StoreTemporaryMetaInfo ( LUString  path,
LUString  info 
)

Stores additional information at a node. The information will lost after exiting the vfs driver

Parameters:
path where to store the info
info Information about that path
Returns:
VFS_STATUS success or error
